intro: Pedicularis coppeyi, commonly known as the coppery lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, often with a distinctive hooded shape. It typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it derives some nutrients from its host plants. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is a subject of interest for botanists and plant enthusiasts alike.
